00175 enum srObjectID
00176 {
00177         OID_Freed = -1,         
00181         OID_Invalid = 0,        
00182         /* The 0xCDAB is a debug aid. It helps us find object IDs in memory
00183          * dumps (on X86, this is ABCD in the dump ;)
00184          * If you are on an embedded device and you would like to save space
00185          * make them 1 byte only.
00186          */
00187         OIDsbFram = 0xCDAB0001,
00188         OIDsbChan = 0xCDAB0002,
00189         OIDsbMesg = 0xCDAB0003,
00190         OIDsbSess = 0xCDAB0004,
00191         OIDsbSock = 0xCDAB0005,
00192         OIDsbProf = 0xCDAB0006,
00193         OIDsrAPI  = 0xCDAB0007,
00194         OIDsrSLMG = 0xCDAB0008,
00195         OIDsbNVTR = 0xCDAB0009,
00196         OIDsbNVTE = 0xCDAB000A,
00197         OIDsbStrB = 0xCDAB000B,
00198         OIDsbLstn = 0xCDAB000C,
00199         OIDsbPSSR = 0xCDAB000D,
00200         OIDsbPSRC = 0xCDAB000E
00201 };
00202 typedef enum srObjectID srObjID;
